revised_title: Anatomy and Life Cycle of the Sea Worm Teredo Gigantea
tldr: The author examines the shell of a sea worm found on the coast of Sumatra and discovers that it belongs to a species of Teredo. They study the anatomy and life cycle of the Teredo navalis, a type of boring worm that does not live in wood. The author also describes the worm's external and internal structures, as well as its method of boring into wood.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Marine Biology
